Data conversion functions

This section shows the different conversion functions used in AERzip. As with the compression functions, there is a picture showing the functions needed to convert a data type into another, in the context of uncompressed data.

There is the list of conversion functions:

AERzip.conversionFunctions.bytesToSpikesFile(bytes_data, initial_address_size, initial_timestamp_size, verbose=True)

Converts a bytearray of raw spikes of a-byte addresses and b-byte timestamps, where a and b are initial_address_size and initial_timestamp_size fields, respectively, to a SpikesFile of raw spikes of the same shape (or with 4-byte addresses or timestamps if a or b are equal to 3 bytes).

This is the inverse function of the spikesFileToBytes function.

Parameters

  • bytes_data (bytearray) – The input bytearray. It must contain raw spikes data (without headers).

  • initial_address_size (int) – An int indicating the size of the addresses in bytes_data.

  • initial_timestamp_size (int) – An int indicating the size of the timestamps in bytes_data.

  • verbose (boolean) – A boolean indicating whether or not debug comments are printed.

Returns

This function returns three different objects, listed below:

  • spikes_file (SpikesFile): The output SpikesFile object from pyNAVIS.

  • final_address_size (int): An int indicating the size of the addresses in the final SpikesFile.

  • final_timestamp_size (int): An int indicating the size of the timestamps in the final SpikesFile.

AERzip.conversionFunctions.calcRequiredBytes(spikes_file, settings)

Calculates the minimum number of bytes required for address and timestamp representation based on the input settings and returns them. This function only works for uncompressed files because compressed files already contain this information within their headers.

Note that, since input settings are contained in a MainSettings object from pyNAVIS, this function is only useful for NAS aedat files.

Parameters

  • spikes_file (SpikesFile) – The input SpikesFile object from pyNAVIS.

  • settings (MainSettings) – A MainSettings object from pyNAVIS.

Returns

A CompressedFileHeader object.

Return type

CompressedFileHeader

AERzip.conversionFunctions.constructStruct(first_field, first_field_size, second_field, second_file_size)

Constructs a numpy data type of two fields to represent the data structure of a bytearray. This function has been internally used to simplify the AERzip’s code, but it should not be needed in an external use of the package.

Parameters

  • first_field (string) – A string indicating the name of the first field.

  • first_field_size ((int, tuple)) – An int or tuple indicating the number of bytes of the elements of the first field.

  • second_field (string) – A string indicating the name of the second field.

  • second_file_size ((int, tuple)) – An int or tuple indicating the number of bytes of the elements of the second field.

Returns

A numpy data type structure required to interpret a bytearray.

AERzip.conversionFunctions.spikesFileToBytes(spikes_file, initial_address_size, initial_timestamp_size, final_address_size, final_timestamp_size, verbose=True)

Converts a SpikesFile of raw spikes of a-byte addresses and b-byte timestamps, where a and b are specified by settings, to a bytearray of raw spikes of c-byte addresses and d-byte timestamps, where c and d are final_address_size and final_timestamp_size, respectively.

This is the inverse function of the bytesToSpikesFile function.

Parameters

  • spikes_file (SpikesFile) – The input SpikesFile object from pyNAVIS.

  • initial_address_size (int) – An int indicating the size of the addresses in spikes_file.

  • initial_timestamp_size (int) – An int indicating the size of the timestamps in spikes_file.

  • final_address_size (int) – An int indicating the size of the addresses in the final bytearray.

  • final_timestamp_size (int) – An int indicating the size of the timestamps in the final bytearray.

  • verbose (boolean) – A boolean indicating whether or not debug comments must be printed.

Returns

The output bytearray.

Return type

bytearray
